TextBody:
Hi Rehaan, thank you for your time on meeting today, we've reviewed the current state of the issue, once the job fails please upload:
1. SP_SEEK scans - default location for logs is C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITJobsGROUP_SharePointGROUP_0.CollectionJOB_1-SPSEEK_SystemScansOUTPUT
2. Sensitive data logs - default location is C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITSensitiveDatalogs

Additionally, I've noticed issues with disk on system level, it looks like it happens every evening at 22:30-22:50, please investigate that issue as potentially it could be a root cause.

There was another issue with VSS service having a major delay around 30000 ms which could also indicate issues with infrastructure, I would suggest to check with IT Security team to double check if EPP - Symantec is interfering.

Make sure antivirus exclusions are added:

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Admin/Maintenance/AntivirusExclusions.htm


Best Regards,
Damir Akhmatshin
Support Engineer EMEA
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy
300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Hi Rehaan, we're currently working on logs you've sent to us with development team, I will get back to you once I have some feedback from them, it will be likely by tomorrow morning.

On meeting, I've noticed issues on system level, related to disk and since this issue occurs in the same timeframe I've suggested checking with IT security team to check if end point protection runs scans during that timeframe. This comment could be found in my summary from March 19, 2025.

Could you please advise if you've got any feedback from IT security team or from infrastructure team, on what could occur on daily basis on application server? And could this event interfere with our scan?

Those events could be looked up in Windows Event Viewer in System and in Application logs.

Best Regards,
Damir Akhmatshin
Support Engineer EMEA
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy
300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000M3dkx:ref

Hi DAMIR , you mentioned on the logs that you have seen some traffic being blocked can you please share that with me so that i can chat to the firewall team to have a look and the log
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #436256 - sharepoint scans

TextBody:
Hi Reyhaan, definitely! Please find log in attachment, here is the line where we see the network issue occurring:

02/03/2025 00:43:54    INFO    TSPADOEngineTransportItf.DebugLog    TSPEngineTransportItf.CommitHostMessage(CommitMessage)    "[ERROR] : [DBNETLIB][ConnectionWrite (send()).]General network error. Check your network documentation"            12092    15832    14656
    

Best Regards,
Damir Akhmatshin
Support Engineer EMEA

TextBody:
Hi Reyhaan, could you please provide an update? Have you managed to perform scan from a different host?

 Additionally, our development team requested to provide job logs and sdd logs that are from the scan that the new dump files are from.

Sdd logs can be found here C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITSensitiveDatalogs

Job logs can be found by right-clicking on job and pressing Explore button, OUTPUT folder should contain logs for job.

Best Regards,
Damir Akhmatshin
Support Engineer EMEA
